heading: BACHELOR OF SCIENCE IN NURSING (B.SC. NURSING)

overview.courseDesc: The Bachelor of Science in Nursing (B.Sc. Nursing) is an esteemed four-year undergraduate program meticulously crafted to cultivate proficient and compassionate healthcare professionals. This program adheres to the rigorous standards established by the Indian Nursing Council (INC) and aims to equip students with the requisite knowledge, clinical expertise, and ethical framework essential for exemplary nursing practice in diverse healthcare settings. The curriculum seamlessly integrates theoretical instruction with hands-on clinical exposure, fostering holistic development in both cognitive and psychomotor domains.
overview.courseFeature: Curriculum aligned with Indian Nursing Council (INC) standards. Blend of theoretical knowledge and clinical experience.
overview.courseLearn: Graduates will be equipped with clinical, ethical, and leadership skills essential in the nursing field.
eligibilityCriteria: Minimum age of 17 years at the time of admission.
Passed 10+2 with core subjects: Physics, Chemistry, Biology, and English.
Candidates from National Institute of Open School must have 45% marks.
Must be free from physical or mental disability. Concealed prior illness may lead to discharge.
